description: This Java source file defines the MockACECluster class, a mock implementation of an ACE (Arm/Disarm Control Entry) cluster used in testing and simulation of security system functionalities within a Zigbee environment. It includes methods for requesting panel state changes, handling commands, and parsing panel statuses, along with nested enums and constants for various statuses and commands.

classes.name: MockACECluster
classes.description: A mock implementation of an ACE cluster simulating security system commands and statuses for testing purposes.

classes.name: MockACECluster.ArmMode
classes.description: Enumeration representing various arm modes of the security system (DISARM, ARM_DAY, ARM_NIGHT, ARM_ALL).

classes.name: MockACECluster.AlarmStatus
classes.description: Constants representing different alarm states such as NO_ALARM, BURGLAR, FIRE, etc.

classes.name: MockACECluster.PanelStatus
classes.description: Constants representing different panel statuses like DISARMED, ARMED_STAY, ARMED_NIGHT, etc.

classes.name: MockACECluster.ArmNotification
classes.description: Constants representing various arm notifications such as ALL_DISARMED, DAY_ARMED, etc.

methods.name: MockACECluster
methods.description: Constructor initializing the mock ACE cluster with EUI64 and endpoint ID.

methods.name: requestPanelStateChange
methods.description: Simulates a request to change the panel state (arm/disarm) with an access code and arm mode.

methods.name: parsePanelStatus
methods.description: Parses the payload received for panel status and updates internal state accordingly.

methods.name: handleCommand
methods.description: Handles incoming commands based on command ID and payload, parsing responses and status changes.

methods.name: isAudible
methods.description: Indicates whether the alarm is audible.
